member.name: M:ScreenRecorderLib.DynamicOptionsBuilder.Apply
member.summary: Apply the changes to the current active recording. Fails if no recording is in progress.
member.returns: True if successfully applied changes to a recording in progress, else false

member.name: M:ScreenRecorderLib.DynamicOptionsBuilder.SetVideoCaptureEnabledForOverlay(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Configure if video capture is enabled for the overlay with the given ID.
member.param: ID for a recording source in progress
If false, the overlay will be blacked out for the duration.

member.name: M:ScreenRecorderLib.DynamicOptionsBuilder.SetVideoCaptureEnabledForRecordingSource(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Configure if video capture is enabled for the recording source with the given ID.
member.param: ID for a recording source in progress
If false, the source will be blacked out for the duration.

member.name: M:ScreenRecorderLib.DynamicOptionsBuilder.SetAnchorForOverlay(System.String,ScreenRecorderLib.Anchor)
member.summary: Set the position anchor for the overlay with the given ID.
member.param: ID for an overlay in progress
Where to anchor the overlay

member.name: M:ScreenRecorderLib.DynamicOptionsBuilder.SetOffsetForOverlay(System.String,ScreenRecorderLib.ScreenSize)
member.summary: Set the position offset of the overlay with the given ID.
member.param: ID for an overlay in progress
The offset for the overlay, relative to the configured Anchor.

member.name: M:ScreenRecorderLib.DynamicOptionsBuilder.SetSizeForOverlay(System.String,ScreenRecorderLib.ScreenSize)
member.summary: Set the size of the overlay with the given ID.
member.param: ID for a recording source in progress
The size of the overlay in pixels

member.name: M:ScreenRecorderLib.DynamicOptionsBuilder.SetCursorCaptureForOverlay(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable mouse cursor capture for the recording overlay with the given ID.
member.param: ID for a recording source in progress

member.name: M:ScreenRecorderLib.DynamicOptionsBuilder.SetCursorCaptureForRecordingSource(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable mouse cursor capture for the recording source with the given ID.
member.param: ID for a recording source in progress

member.name: M:ScreenRecorderLib.DynamicOptionsBuilder.SetSourceRectForRecordingSource(System.String,ScreenRecorderLib.ScreenRect)
member.summary: Set the source rect (crop) for a recording source with the given ID.
member.param: ID for a recording source in progress

member.name: M:ScreenRecorderLib.Recorder.GetDynamicOptionsBuilder
member.summary: DynamicOptionsBuilder can be used to update a subset of options while a recording is in progress.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.LogOptions.LogSeverityLevel
member.summary: The maximum level of the logs to write.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.LogOptions.LogFilePath
member.summary: A path to a file to write logs to. If this is not empty, all logs will be redirected to it.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.LogOptions.IsLogEnabled
member.summary: Toggles logging. Default is on when debugging, off in release mode, this setting overrides it.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.MouseOptions.MouseClickDetectionMode
member.summary: The mode for detecting mouse clicks. Default is Polling.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.DynamicMouseOptions.MouseClickDetectionDuration
member.summary: The duration of the dot shown where the mouse button is pressed, in milliseconds. Default is 150.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.DynamicMouseOptions.MouseClickDetectionRadius
member.summary: The radius of the dot where the mouse button is pressed. Default is 20.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.DynamicMouseOptions.MouseRightClickDetectionColor
member.summary: The color of the dot where the right mouse button is pressed, in hex format. Default is Yellow (#FFFF00).

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.DynamicMouseOptions.MouseLeftClickDetectionColor
member.summary: The color of the dot where the left mouse button is pressed, in hex format. Default is Yellow (#FFFF00).

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.DynamicMouseOptions.IsMouseClicksDetected
member.summary: Display a colored dot where the left mouse button is pressed.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.DynamicMouseOptions.IsMousePointerEnabled
member.summary: Display the mouse cursor on the recording

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.AudioOptions.AudioInputDevice
member.summary: Audio input device (e.g. microphone) to capture audio from. Pass null or empty string to select system default.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.AudioOptions.AudioOutputDevice
member.summary: Audio device to capture system audio from via loopback capture. Pass null or empty string to select system default.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.AudioOptions.IsAudioEnabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the writing of an audio track for the recording.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.DynamicAudioOptions.OutputVolume
member.summary: Volume of the output stream. Recommended values are between 0 and 1. Value of 0 mutes the stream and value of 1 makes it original volume. This value can be changed after the recording is started with SetOutputVolume() method.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.DynamicAudioOptions.InputVolume
member.summary: Volume of the input stream. Recommended values are between 0 and 1. Value of 0 mutes the stream and value of 1 makes it original volume. This value can be changed after the recording is started with SetInputVolume() method.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.DynamicAudioOptions.IsInputDeviceEnabled
member.summary: Enable to record system audio input (e.g. microphone)

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.DynamicAudioOptions.IsOutputDeviceEnabled
member.summary: Enable to record system audio output.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.SnapshotOptions.SnapshotsDirectory
member.summary: Directory to store snapshots. If not set, the directory of the output file is used.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.SnapshotOptions.SnapshotsIntervalMillis
member.summary: Interval in milliseconds between images in slideshows, or snapshots in a video recording.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.SnapshotOptions.SnapshotsWithVideo
member.summary: Whether to take snapshots in a video recording. This is only used with Video mode.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.SnapshotOptions.SnapshotFormat
member.summary: Image format for snapshots. This is used with Screenshot, Slideshow, and video with SnapshotsWithVideo enabled.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoEncoderOptions.Encoder
member.summary: Set the video encoder to use. Current supported encoders are H264VideoEncoder and H265VideoEncoder.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoEncoderOptions.IsFragmentedMp4Enabled
member.summary: Fragments the video into a list of individually playable blocks. This allows playback of video segments that has no end, i.e. live streaming.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoEncoderOptions.IsMp4FastStartEnabled
member.summary: Place the mp4 header at the start of the file instead of the end. This allows streaming to start before entire file is downloaded.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoEncoderOptions.IsHardwareEncodingEnabled
member.summary: Enable hardware encoding if available. This is enabled by default.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoEncoderOptions.IsLowLatencyEnabled
member.summary: Faster rendering, but can affect quality. Use when speed is more important than quality.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoEncoderOptions.IsThrottlingDisabled
member.summary: Disable throttling of video renderer. If this is disabled, all frames are sent to renderer as fast as they come. Can cause out of memory crashes.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoEncoderOptions.IsFixedFramerate
member.summary: Send data to the video encoder every frame, even if it means duplicating the previous frame(s). Can fix stutter issues in fringe cases, but uses more resources.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoEncoderOptions.Quality
member.summary: Video quality. This is only used when BitrateMode is set to Quality.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoEncoderOptions.Bitrate
member.summary: Bitrate in bits per second

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoEncoderOptions.Framerate
member.summary: Framerate in frames per second.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.OutputOptions.OutputFrameSize
member.summary: The frame size of the output in pixels.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.OutputOptions.Stretch
member.summary: How the output should be stretched to fill the destination rectangle.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.DynamicOutputOptions.IsVideoCaptureEnabled
member.summary: Controls whether the video output is recorded. If false, only audio is recorded if enabled, and video will be black.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.DynamicOutputOptions.SourceRect
member.summary: The part of the output to record. Null or empty records the entire source area, else the output is cropped to the rectangle.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.RecorderMode.Screenshot
member.summary: Create a single screenshot.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.RecorderMode.Slideshow
member.summary: Record a slideshow of pictures.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.RecorderMode.Video
member.summary: Record to mp4 container in H.264/AVC or H.265/HEVC format.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.MouseDetectionMode.Hook
member.summary: Use a low level system hook for detecting mouse clicks. Works more reliably for programmatic events, but can negatively affect mouse performance while recording.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.MouseDetectionMode.Polling
member.summary: Use polling for detecting mouse clicks. Does not affect mouse performance, but may not work for all mouse clicks generated programmatically.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.H265VideoEncoder.BitrateMode
member.summary: The bitrate control mode of the video encoder. Default is Quality.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.H265VideoEncoder.EncoderProfile
member.summary: The capabilities the h265 video encoder. At the moment only Main is supported

member.name: T:ScreenRecorderLib.H265VideoEncoder
member.summary: Encode video with H265/HEVC encoder.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.H264VideoEncoder.BitrateMode
member.summary: The bitrate control mode of the video encoder. Default is Quality.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.H264VideoEncoder.EncoderProfile
member.summary: The capabilities the h264 video encoder. Lesser profiles may increase playback compatibility and use less resources with older decoders and hardware at the cost of quality.

member.name: T:ScreenRecorderLib.H264VideoEncoder
member.summary: Encode video with H264 encoder.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoEncoderFormat.H265
member.summary: H.265/HEVC encoder.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoEncoderFormat.H264
member.summary: H.264/AVC encoder.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.H265BitrateControlMode.Quality
member.summary: Quality-based VBR encoding. The encoder selects the bit rate to match a specified quality level. Set Quality level in VideoEncoderOptions from 1-100. Default is 70.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.H265BitrateControlMode.CBR
member.summary: Constant bitrate. Faster encoding than VBR, but produces larger files with consistent size. This setting might not work on software encoding.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.H264BitrateControlMode.Quality
member.summary: Quality-based VBR encoding. The encoder selects the bit rate to match a specified quality level. Set Quality level in VideoEncoderOptions from 1-100. Default is 70.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.H264BitrateControlMode.UnconstrainedVBR
member.summary: Default is unconstrained variable bitrate. Overall bitrate will average towards the Bitrate property, but can fluctuate greatly over and under it.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.H264BitrateControlMode.CBR
member.summary: Constant bitrate. Faster encoding than VBR, but produces larger files with consistent size. This setting might not work on software encoding.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.WindowOverlay.IsCursorCaptureEnabled
member.summary: This option determines if the mouse cursor is recorded for this source. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.DisplayOverlay.IsCursorCaptureEnabled
member.summary: This option determines if the mouse cursor is recorded for this source. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecordingOverlayBase.Offset
member.summary: This option can be configured to position the overlay within the output frame.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecordingOverlayBase.Size
member.summary: This option can be configured to set the size of this overlay in pixels.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecordingOverlayBase.AnchorPoint
member.summary: The point on the parent frame where the overlay anchors to.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecordingOverlayBase.Stretch
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that describes how an overlay should be stretched to fill the destination rectangle.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecordingOverlayBase.ID
member.summary: A unique generated ID for this recording source.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.ImageRecordingSource.SourcePath
member.summary: The file path to the video

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoRecordingSource.SourcePath
member.summary: The file path to the video

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoCaptureRecordingSource.DeviceName
member.summary: The device name to record

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.DisplayRecordingSource.IsCursorCaptureEnabled
member.summary: This option determines if the mouse cursor is recorded for this source. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.DisplayRecordingSource.DeviceName
member.summary: The device name to record, e.g. \\\\.\\DISPLAY1

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.WindowRecordingSource.IsCursorCaptureEnabled
member.summary: This option determines if the mouse cursor is recorded for this source. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.WindowRecordingSource.Handle
member.summary: The handle to the window to record.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecordingSourceBase.Stretch
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that describes how a recording source should be stretched to fill the destination rectangle.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecordingSourceBase.AnchorPoint
member.summary: The point where the source anchors to.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecordingSourceBase.Position
member.summary: This option can be configured to position the source frame within the output frame.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecordingSourceBase.OutputSize
member.summary: This option can be configured to set the frame size of this source in pixels.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecordingSourceBase.ID
member.summary: A unique generated ID for this recording source.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.RecorderApi.WindowsGraphicsCapture
member.summary: WindowsGraphicsCapture requires Windows 10 version 1803 or higher. This API supports recording windows in addition to screens.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.RecorderApi.DesktopDuplication
member.summary: Desktop Duplication is supported on all Windows 8 and 10 versions. This API supports recording of screens.

member.name: T:ScreenRecorderLib.StretchMode
member.summary: Describes how content is resized to fill its allocated space.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.StretchMode.Uniform
member.summary: The content is resized to fit in the destination dimensions while it preserves its native aspect ratio.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.StretchMode.Fill
member.summary: The content is resized to fill the destination dimensions. The aspect ratio is not preserved.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.StretchMode.None
member.summary: The content preserves its original size.
Calls the RecordingComplete or RecordingFailed callbacks depending on the success of the recording result.
member.param: The recording result.
A map of paths to saved frames with corresponding delay between them. Only used for Slideshow mode.

member.name: M:RecordingManager.CleanupDxResources
member.summary: Releases DirectX resources and reports any leaks

member.name: M:RecordingManager.ProcessTextureTransforms(ID3D11Texture2D*,ID3D11Texture2D**,tagRECT,tagSIZE)
member.summary: Perform cropping and resizing on texture if needed.
member.param: The texture to process
The output texture. If no transformations are done, the original texture is returned.
The source rectangle. The texture will be cropped to these coordinates if larger.
The output dimensions. The texture will be resized to these coordinates if differing.
member.returns: S_OK if any processing has been done, S_FALSE if no changes, else an error code

member.name: M:RecordingManager.SaveTextureAsVideoSnapshot(ID3D11Texture2D*,tagRECT)
member.summary: Save texture as image to video snapshot folder.
member.param: The texture to save to a snapshot
The area of the texture to save. If the texture is larger, it will be cropped to these coordinates.

member.name: M:RecordingManager.InitializeRects(tagSIZE,tagRECT*,tagSIZE*)
member.summary: Creates adjusted source and output rects from a recording frame rect. The source rect is normalized to start on [0,0], and the output is adjusted for any cropping.
member.param: The recording output size
The source rect adjusted to start on [0,0] and with custom cropping if any
The destination rect adjusted to start on [0,0] and with custom render size if any

member.name: M:CaptureBase.GetContentOffset(ContentAnchor,tagRECT,tagRECT)
member.summary: Calculate the offset used to position the content withing the parent frame based on the given anchor.

member.name: M:TextureManager.CopyTextureWithCPU(ID3D11Device*,ID3D11Texture2D*,ID3D11Texture2D**)
member.summary: Copy a texture via the CPU. This can be used to copy a texture created on one physical device to be rendered on another.
member.param: The device with which to create the texture copy
The texture to copy
The copied texture

member.name: M:TextureManager.CropTexture(ID3D11Texture2D*,tagRECT,ID3D11Texture2D**)
member.summary: Crops a texture to the given rectangle.
member.param: The texture to crop
A rectangle to crop the texture to
The cropped texture
member.returns: S_OK if successful, S_FALSE is crop rect is larger than texture, error code on failure

member.name: M:GetMonitorName(HMONITOR__*)
member.summary: Gets the display name of the monitor corresponding to the monitor handle.
member.param: A handle to a monitor
member.returns: The display name of the monitor

member.name: M:GetCombinedRects(std.vector<tagRECT,std.allocator<tagRECT>>,tagRECT*,std.vector<tagSIZE,std.allocator<tagSIZE>>*)
member.summary: Creates a union of the input rectangles. The union is the smallest rectangle that contains all source rectangles.
member.param: A vector of RECT coordinates to combine.
The combined union of input rectangles.
Optional vector containing offsets corresponding to any gaps between input rects.

member.name: M:EnumOutputs(std.vector<IDXGIOutput**,std.allocator<IDXGIOutput**>>*)
member.summary: Creates a list of all display adapters on the system.
member.param: A vector containing IDXGIOutput interfaces

member.name: M:InitShaders(ID3D11Device*,ID3D11PixelShader**,ID3D11VertexShader**,ID3D11InputLayout**)
member.summary: Initialize shaders for drawing to screen
Create the recording output rectangles for each source in the input, based on their coordinates and any custom size, crop or position rules.
member.param: The recording sources to process
A vector of pairs, containing the source and corresponding rectangle.

member.name: M:GetMainOutput(IDXGIOutput**)
member.summary: Returns the main display output of the system.
member.param: The IDXGIOutput corresponding to the main output

members.member: Finalize must be called even when Initialize() is failed

@param resampleInputBytes input buffer bytes of Resample(). this arg is used to calculate expected output buffer size @param sampleData_return [out] set fresh (its data shold not be allocated yet) WWMFSampleData instance as this arg
@bytes buffer bytes. must be smaller than approx. 512KB to convert 44100Hz to 192000Hz

If this instance is not empty, rhs content is concatenated to this instance. rhs remains untouched. If this instance is empty, rhs content moves to this instance. rhs becomes empty. rhs.Release() must be called to release memory either way!
@param aData must point new[] ed memory address
WWMFSampleData contains new[] ed byte buffer pointer(data) and buffer size(bytes).
sample data type. int or float it is compatible to WWBitFormatType on WasapiUser.h

member.name: F:RECORDING_SOURCE_DATA.FrameCoordinates
member.summary: Describes the position and size of this recording source within the recording surface.

member.name: F:RECORDING_SOURCE.Position
member.summary: Optional custom position for the source frame.

member.name: F:RECORDING_SOURCE.SourceRect
member.summary: An optional custom area of the source to record. Must be equal or smaller than the source area. A smaller area will crop the source.

member.name: F:RECORDING_OVERLAY.Offset
member.summary: Optional custom offset for the source frame.

member.name: F:RECORDING_SOURCE_BASE.IsCursorCaptureEnabled
member.summary: Determines if the source is capturing mouse cursors. If false, it will be hidden.

member.name: F:RECORDING_SOURCE_BASE.IsVideoCaptureEnabled
member.summary: Determines if the source is capturing video. If false, it will be blacked out.

member.name: F:RECORDING_SOURCE_BASE.Anchor
member.summary: The anchor position for the content inside the parent frame.

member.name: F:RECORDING_SOURCE_BASE.OutputSize
member.summary: Optional custom output size of the source frame. May be both smaller or larger than the source.

member.name: F:RECORDING_SOURCE_BASE.Stretch
member.summary: Stretch mode for the frame

member.name: F:Uniform
member.summary: The content is resized to fit in the destination dimensions while it preserves its native aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Fill
member.summary: The content is resized to fill the destination dimensions. The aspect ratio is not preserved.

member.name: F:None
member.summary: The content preserves its original size.

member.name: F:Screenshot
member.summary: Create a single screenshot.

member.name: F:Slideshow
member.summary: Record a slideshow of pictures.

member.name: F:Video
member.summary: Record to mp4 container in H.264/AVC or H.265/HEVC format.

member.name: M:MakeEven(System.Int32!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsLong,System.Int32)
member.summary: Forces the dimensions of n to be even by adding 1*modifier pixel if odd.

member.name: M:MakeRectEven(tagRECT*!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsImplicitlyDereferenced,System.Int32)
member.summary: Forces the dimensions of rect to be even by adding 1*modifier pixel if odd.
